p: Flaviviridae are single-stranded RNA viruses of which tick-borne encephalitis virus, Japanese encephalitis virus, Zika virus and West Nile virus (WNV) are responsible for severe CNS infections [ 3]. These viruses are transmitted through tick or mosquito bites and are therefore also referred to as arboviruses. The term “arbovirus” is an acronym for “ ARthropod- BOrne” virus, including not only flaviviruses, but also other viruses, like chikungunya virus, from the family Togaviridae [ 58].
